AddressDetail.description: The details of the data address.

AddressType.description: The type of the data address.

Domain.description: The domain name of the bucket.

AccessId.description: The AccessKey ID that is used to access the bucket.

AccessSecret.description: The AccessKey secret that is used to access the bucket.

Role.description: The role that is used to migrate data. If the bucket is an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket, you must specify a role. You do not need to specify an AccessKey pair that is used to access the bucket.

InvDomain.description: The domain name of the bucket in which the inventory list resides.

InvBucket.description: The name of the bucket in which the inventory list resides.

InvAccessId.description: The AccessKey ID that is used to access the bucket in which the inventory list resides.

InvAccessSecret.description: The AccessKey secret that is used to access the bucket in which the inventory list resides.

InvPath.description: The inventory list. You must specify the file name and file name extension of the inventory list.

InvRole.description: The role that is used to migrate data for the bucket in which the inventory list resides. If the bucket in which the inventory list resides is an OSS bucket, you must specify a role. You do not need to specify an AccessKey pair that is used to access the bucket.

InvLocation.description:
The type of the bucket in which the inventory list resides.\
Valid values: oss, s3, and cos.

AgentList.description: The associated agents. If you want to access data over an Express Connect circuit or a VPN gateway, you must associate agents.

RegionId.description: The region ID of the bucket. If the bucket is an OSS bucket, you must specify the ID of the region in which the bucket resides. You do not need to specify the domain name of the bucket.

InvRegionId.description: The region ID of the bucket in which the inventory list resides. If the bucket in which the inventory list resides is an OSS bucket, you must specify the ID of the region in which the inventory list resides. You do not need to specify the domain name of the inventory list.

LogMode.description: Specifies whether to push migration logs to Simple Log Service (SLS). To push migration logs to SLS, you must create the AliyunOSSImportSlsAuditRole role and grant the required permissions to the role. Valid values: off, basic, and detail. off: does not push migration logs. basic: pushes only migration failure logs. detail: pushes migration success logs and migration failure logs.

CreateAddressInfo.description: The information about the data address.

Name.description:
The name of the data address.\
The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name is case-sensitive and encoded in UTF-8. The name cannot start with a hyphen (-) or an underscore (\_). You must specify a name.

AddressDetail.description: The details of the data address.

Tags.description:
The tags in the key:value format.\
The value can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), underscores (\_), and commas (,). The value can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

Name.description:
The name of the agent.\
The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name is case-sensitive and encoded in UTF-8. The name cannot start with a hyphen (-) or an underscore (\_). You must specify a name.

DeployMethod.description:
The deployment mode of the agent.\
Set the value to default, which specifies the independent process mode.

AgentEndpoint.description:
The method that is used to access the agent.\
Valid values: public and vpc.

Tags.description:
The tags in the key:value format.\
The value can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), underscores (\_), and commas (,). The value can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

CreateJobInfo.description: The information about the migration task.

Name.description:
The task name.\
The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name is case-sensitive and encoded in UTF-8. The name cannot start with a hyphen (-) or an underscore (\_). You must specify a name.

SrcAddress.description: The name of the source data address.

DestAddress.description: The name of the destination data address.

OverwriteMode.description:
The file overwriting mode.\
Valid values: never and always.

TransferMode.description:
The file transfer mode.\
Valid values: all and lastmodified. all: transfers the full data of files. lastmodified: transfers the incremental data of files.\
Valid values if OverwriteMode and TransferMode are used together:

*   A combination of always and all indicates that all files are forcefully overwritten.
*   A combination of always and lastmodified indicates that files are overwritten based on the last modification time.
*   A combination of never and all indicates that the files with the same name are not overwritten.

Tags.description:
The tags in the key:value format.\
The value can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), underscores (\_), and commas (,). The value can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

ParentVersion.description: The ID of the parent task. When you create a subtask to migrate a file that failed to be migrated, you can specify the ID of the parent task.

ConvertSymlinkTarget.description: Indicates whether the Target attribute value of the symbolic links at the source data address is converted. You can convert the Target attribute value of the symbolic links at the source data address in one of the following scenarios: The source data address is an Object Storage Service (OSS) data address and the destination data address is a local data address. The source data address is a local data address and the destination data address is an OSS data address. The source data address is a local data address and the destination data address is another local data address. This ensures that the symbolic links at the destination data address can point to their objects as expected.

EnableMultiVersioning.description: Specifies whether to enable multi-version migration. Multi-version migration is not supported.

ImportQos.description: The throttling settings of the task.

CreateReport.description: Specifies whether to create a migration report.

CreateReportInfo.description: The information about the migration report.

RuntimeId.description: The execution ID of the task.

TunnelQos.description: The throttling settings of the tunnel.

Tags.description:
The tags in the key:value format.\
The value can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), underscores (\_), and commas (,). The value can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

FileTypeFilters.title: A short description of struct
FileTypeFilters.description: The filter based on the file type.

ExcludeSymlink.description: Specifies whether to filter out symbolic links.

ExcludeDir.description: Specifies whether to filter out files in directories.

KeyFilters.description: The filter based on the file name.

LastModifiedFilters.description: The filter based on the file modification time.

FileTypeFilters.description: The filter based on the file type.

Owner.description: The owner of the data address.

Name.description: The name of the data address.

AddressDetail.description: The details of the data address.

CreateTime.description: The time when the data address was created.

ModifyTime.description: The time when the data address was last modified.

VerifyTime.description: The time when the data address was verified.

Version.description: The ID of the data address.

Status.description: The state of the data address.

VerifyResult.description: The verification result of the data address.

CreateTime.description: The time when the agent was created.

ModifyTime.description: The time when the agent was last modified.

DeployMethod.description: The deployment mode of the agent.

AgentEndpoint.description: The method that is used to access the agent.

ActivationKey.description: The security code of the agent.

GetAgentStatusResp.description: The queried state of the agent.

Status.description:
The agent state.\
Valid values: OK, Disconnected, and NoResponse.

SrcAddress.description: The name of the source data address.

DestAddress.description: The name of the destination data address.

Status.description:
The task state. Valid values:

IMPORT_JOB_BEGIN: The task is created.

IMPORT_JOB_LAUNCHING: The task is being started.

IMPORT_JOB_PREPARING: The system is preparing for the task.

IMPORT_JOB_DOING: The task is running.

IMPORT_JOB_SUSPEND: The task is paused.

IMPORT_JOB_CLOSING: The task is being closed.

IMPORT_JOB_FINISHED: The task is complete.

IMPORT_JOB_INTERRUPTED: The task is abnormally interrupted.

IMPORT_JOB_CONFIRMED: The task is complete and the user has confirmed the data integrity and consistency.

EnableMultiVersioning.description: Indicates whether multi-version migration is enabled.

CreateTime.description: The time when the task was created.

ModifyTime.description: The time when the task was modified.

ParentName.description: The name of the parent task.

ParentVersion.description: The ID of the parent task.

ConvertSymlinkTarget.description: Indicates whether the Target attribute value of the symbolic links at the source data address is converted.

CreateReport.description: Indicates whether a migration report is created.

ImportQos.description: The throttling settings of the task.

GetJobResultResp.description: The retry information about the migration task.

ReadyRetry.description:
Indicates whether the files that failed to be migrated can be migrated again.\
Valid values: NoNeed, Ready, and NotReady.

InvPath.description: The inventory list of files that failed to be migrated. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvBucket.description: The name of the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvDomain.description: The domain name of the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvLocation.description: The type of the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvAccessId.description: The AccessKey ID that is used to access the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvAccessSecret.description: The AccessKey secret that is used to access the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

InvRegionId.description: The region ID of the bucket in which the inventory list of files that failed to be migrated resides. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

AddressType.description: The type of the data address created based on the files that failed to be migrated. This parameter is required if you create a data address.

CopiedObjectCount.description: The number of files that are migrated. The number includes the number of files that are successfully migrated and the number of files that are skipped.

FailedObjectCount.description: The number of files that failed to be migrated.

TotalObjectSize.description: The total data size of files.

CopiedObjectSize.description: The data size of files that are migrated.

Status.description:
The state of the migration report.\
Valid values: Running, NotExist, Finished, and Failed.

ReportCreateTime.description: The time when the migration report was created.

ReportEndTime.description: The time when the migration report was generated.

CopiedCount.description: The number of files that are migrated.

SkippedCount.description: The number of files that are skipped.

FailedCount.description: The number of files that failed to be migrated.

JobCreateTime.description: The time when the task was created.

JobEndTime.description: The time when the task ended.

SkippedListPrefix.description: The path of files that are skipped.

FailedListPrefix.description: The path of files that failed to be migrated.

CreateTime.description: The time when the tunnel was created.

ModifyTime.description: The time when the tunnel was last modified.

TunnelQos.description: The throttling settings of the tunnel.

ImportQos.description: The throttling settings of the task.

MaxImportTaskQps.title: QPS
MaxImportTaskQps.description: The number of files that are migrated per second.

JobHistory.description: The execution history of the migration task.

RuntimeId.description: The execution ID of the task.

CommitId.description: The ID of the task status change.

StartTime.description: The time when the current state started.

EndTime.description: The time when the current state ended.

CopiedCount.description: The number of files that are migrated. The number includes the number of files that are successfully migrated and the number of files that are skipped.

FailedCount.description: The number of files that failed to be migrated.

TotalSize.description: The total data size of files. Unit: bytes.

CopiedSize.description: The data size of files that are migrated. Unit: bytes.

RuntimeState.description:
The runtime state.\
Valid values: Normal and Interrupt.

Operator.description:
The operator.\
Valid values: user and system.

ListStatus.description:
The state of data listing.\
Valid values: Listing and Finished.

NextMarker.description: The position from which the next list operation starts.

StartCronExpression.description: The time when the migration task started. You can use a CRON expression to specify the time. The interval at which the migration task is run is at least 1 hour.

SuspendCronExpression.description: The time when the migration task paused. You can use a CRON expression to specify the time. The interval at which the migration task is run is at least 1 hour.

MaxScheduleCount.description: The maximum number of times that the migration task is automatically scheduled. Each time the migration task is run, the execution ID increases by one until the task is run the specified number of times. The task is automatically scheduled based on the specified start time and pause time. The task is no longer automatically scheduled after the task is run the specified number of times. However, you can still manually start the task.

StartTime.title: start time
StartTime.description: The time when the migration task started.

EndTime.title: end time
EndTime.description: The time when the migration task ended.

TunnelQos.description: The throttling settings of the tunnel.

MaxQps.description:
The maximum queries per second (QPS) of the tunnel.\
Valid values: values greater than or equal to 0. Default value: 0. The default value indicates that the QPS of the tunnel is not limited.

MaxBandwidth.description:
The maximum bandwidth of the tunnel. Unit: byte/s.\
Valid values: values greater than or equal to 10485760. Default value: 0. The default value indicates that the bandwidth of the tunnel is not limited.

schema.description: The request body for creating the migration task.

ImportJob.description: The details for creating the migration task.

CreateJob.title: CreateJob
CreateJob.description:
*   To create a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:CreateImportJob.
*   Before you create a migration task, you must create data addresses.
*   A migration task can run multiple rounds. Each round has an execution ID.

GetJob.summary: Obtains the details of a migration task.

schema.description: Specifies whether to obtain the details of the migration task by using the task ID.
The name of the migration task. If the byVersion parameter is set to true, this parameter indicates the ID of the migration task.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

ImportJob.description: The details for obtaining the details of the migration task.

GetJob.title: GetJob
GetJob.description: *   To query the information about a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportJob.

ListJob.summary: Lists the migration tasks created by a user in the specific region.

schema.description:
The marker after which the migration tasks are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of migration tasks to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000 (excluding 0).\
Default value: 1000.
The name of the parent task. If this parameter is specified, all subtasks of the parent task are returned.

Specifies whether to return subtasks.\
Valid values: true and false.
The response parameters.

ListJob.title: ListJob
ListJob.description: *   To query a list of migration tasks, you must have the permission on mgw:ListImportJob.

UpdateJob.summary: Updates the status or throttling of a task.

schema.description: The request body for updating the task.

ImportJob.description: The details for updating the task.

schema.description: The task name.

UpdateJob.title: UpdateJob
UpdateJob.description:
*   To update a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:UpdateImportJob.
*   You can update only the status or throttling settings of a task in a single request.

schema.description: Specifies whether to force delete the subtask. If the task has subtasks and you set this parameter to true, the task and its subtasks are forcibly deleted. If this parameter is set to false, the task and its subtasks fail to be deleted.
The task name.

DeleteJob.title: DeleteJob
DeleteJob.description:
*   To delete a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:DeleteImportJob.
*   The operation to delete a migration task is asynchronous. The migration task remains in the Deleting state until it is deleted.

ListJobHistory.summary: Lists the running history of a migration task.

schema.description: The task name.
The execution ID of the task. If you specify an execution ID, only the running history related to the execution ID is listed.

The marker after which the running history of the task is listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of running records of the migration task to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000.\
Default value: 1000.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

JobHistoryList.description: The running history of the migration task.

ListJobHistory.title: ListJobHistory
ListJobHistory.description:
*   To query the execution history of a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:ListImportJobHistory.
*   A migration task can run multiple rounds. A unique execution ID is generated for each round.
*   The execution history of a migration task records the change history of the task status.

schema.description: The request body for creating the migration report.

CreateReport.description: The details for creating the migration report.

CreateReport.title: CreateReport
CreateReport.description:
*   To create a migration report, you must have the permission on mgw:CreateImportReport.
*   If you specify that a migration report is to be generated when you create a migration task, you do not need to call this operation. If you do not specify that a migration report is to be generated when you create a migration task, you can call this operation to create a migration report for an execution with the specified ID.

GetReport.summary: Obtains the details of a migration report.

schema.description: The ID of the migration task.
The execution ID of the migration task.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

GetReportResponse.description: The details for obtaining the migration report.

GetReport.title: GetReport
GetReport.description:
*   To query the information about a migration report, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportReport.
*   The migration report is pushed to the destination data address. For more information, see the "View a migration report" section of the "Subsequent operations" topic in migration tutorials.

GetJobResult.summary: Obtains the list of files that fail to be migrated when files fail to be migrated during a migration task.

schema.description: The task name.
The execution ID of the task.
The response body.

ImportJobResult.description: The details for obtaining the retries of the migration task.

GetJobResult.title: GetJobResult
GetJobResult.description:
*   To query the retry information about a migration task, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportJobResult.
*   If files fail to be migrated during a migration task, a list of files that fail to be migrated is generated. You can call this operation to query this list. You can create a data address based on this list and create a subtask. This way, you can migrate these files again.

schema.description: The request body for creating the data address.

ImportAddress.description: The details for creating the data address.

CreateAddress.title: CreateAddress
CreateAddress.description:
*   To create a data address, you must have the permission on mgw:CreateImportAddress.
*   If you want to use an agent to migrate data, you must create an agent first and then associate the agent with a data address when you create the data address.

GetAddress.summary: Obtains the details of a data address.

schema.description: The name of the data address.

The response body.

Valid values:

*   s:s.

ImportAddress.description:
The details for obtaining the data address.

Valid values:

*   1:1

The marker after which the migration addresses are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of migration addresses to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000 (excluding 0).\
Default value: 1000.

ListAddress.title: ListAddress
ListAddress.description: *   To query a list of data addresses, you must have the permission on mgw:ListImportAddress.

schema.description: The name of the data address.
The request body for updating the data address.

UpdateAddress.title: UpdateAddress
UpdateAddress.description:
*   To update a data address, you must have the permission on mgw:UpdateImportAddress.
*   If the data address is associated with an agent, you can scale up or down the agent.

DeleteAddress.title: DeleteAddress
DeleteAddress.description: *   To delete a data address, you must have the permission on mgw:DeleteImportAddress.

schema.description: The name of the data address.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

VerifyAddressResponse.description: The details for verifying the data address.

VerifyAddress.title: VerifyAddress
VerifyAddress.description:
*   To verify a data address, you must have the permission on mgw:VerifyImportAddress.
*   A data address may not be available even if the data address passes the availability verification. The data migration results prevail.

CreateAgent.summary: The request boy for creating the agent.

schema.description: The request body for creating the agent.

ImportAgent.description: The details for creating the agent.

CreateAgent.title: CreateAgent
CreateAgent.description:
*   To create an agent, you must have the permission on mgw:CreateImportAgent.
*   If you want to migrate data to Alibaba Cloud over an Express Connect circuit or a VPN gateway, or migrate data from a self-managed storage space to Alibaba Cloud, you can deploy an agent.
*   Before you create an agent, you must create a tunnel. An agent must be associated with a tunnel.

GetAgent.summary: Obtains the details of an agent.

schema.description: The agent name.
The response body.

ImportAgent.description: The details for obtaining the details of the agent.

GetAgent.description: *   To query the information about an agent, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportAgent.

The marker after which the agents are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of agents to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000.\
Default value: 1000.

ListAgent.description: *   To query a list of agents, you must have the permission on mgw:ListImportAgent.

The response body.

GetAgentStatus.description: *   To query the status of an agent, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportAgent.

schema.description: The request body for creating the tunnel.

ImportTunnel.description: The details for creating the tunnel.

CreateTunnel.title: CreateTunnel
CreateTunnel.description:
*   To create a tunnel, you must have the permission on mgw:CreateImportTunnel.
*   When you use an agent to migrate data, the agent must be associated with a tunnel.
*   A tunnel can be associated with multiple agents. You can throttle the traffic of the agents that are associated with the same tunnel by setting the bandwidth and the number of requests per second for the tunnel.
CreateTunnel.responseParamsDescription: If the tunnel is created, a tunnel ID is returned in the response header x-oss-import-tunnel-id.

GetTunnel.summary: Obtains the details of a tunnel.

schema.description: The tunnel ID.
The response body.

GetTunnel.description: *   To query the information about a tunnel, you must have the permission on mgw:GetImportTunnel.
